creditline: The Ellen and Fred Wells Fund
description: design of embroidered undulating stripes and large bamboo leaf motifs on a dark blue ground
text: <I>Cho_ken<I>, literally "long silk," is a type of unlined jacket made of semi-transparent, gauze silk fabric into which designs are woven or embroidered with gold-leafed and colored threads. The side seams are not sewn together, which allows it to swing and flutter as the actor dances. While <I>cho_ken<I> are used mainly for female roles, actors portraying noblemen can also wear them.
